title: Elegant and traditional
review: The Palace within the Fort is a display of beautiful rooms, colorful creative art works, and historical information.

title: Skip this if you’re also visiting other palaces in Rajasthan.
review: Only worth visiting if this is your first fort or palace in Rajasthan, not worth the steep foreigner’s price. Displayed material is not interesting and the beautiful stone carving is ubiquitous in Jaisalmer. Spend your time wandering through the alleys or on a rooftop terrace.

title: History buffs will love this...
review: The place is full of historic memories.

title: Learned something by audio tour
review: Walked around with a headset for the audio tour in Japanese.

title: Interesting.
review: Visited here as part of the visit to Jaisalmer fort. Some interesting rooms displaying furniture and objects from a wide historical period of time. Some of the stair cases are quite steep and narrow

title: Beautiful!
review: A lavishly decorated palace within the fort that has been recreated with furniture, photos, and artefacts of the time the maharajah lived and ruled here. Recommended not to miss this tour.

title: Nothing to see
review: We thought at least the museum will have some decent artefacts to look at. There were dusty old pieces that didn't seem to have really been preserved from the days of the rule.

title: go with a guide
review: Its a great old palace like many others in Rajasthan but go with a good guide who is ready to spend to explain - you could easily spend 3 hours

title: difficult to climb for senior citizens, but worth a visit in case one can climb multiple set of seps at various levels.
review: imagine 800 years back ,such a secure building was constructed  and is still well maintained. furniture, dresses, armoury, some intricately carved panels  are all worth seeing.. more over, the view of city from palace topp deck is really amazing. A model of entire fort available on top floor is too good.

title: Tour of Jaisalmer
review: When you visit Jaisalmer. Must visit golden stone fort and Maharaja's palace. Palace need some restoration work to make more beautiful.

title: Palace inside the Fort
review: It was a dampener. Once you get in you see the pictures of celebrities who have visited the palace, Amitabh Bachchan being one of them. Really? It was like a studio owner displaying his visitors. The place can be managed in a better manner and with more dignity and pinch of history. The tourists are charged decently, however, what is on offer shows clearly, the lack of interest on part of the royals managing the show. Alas, you visit it because it is part of the fort and you go in because you have to

title: Awesome
review: One of part of Golden Jaisalmer palace and different type of antique items are displayed but sorry to say lack of proper maintenance. No efforts to revive the same, Othetwise best one to visit.

title: Luxurious Place
review: This place is hot dusty sandy Jaisalmer is well situated in the heart of the city. The restaurant is opulent and setting grand. But you got to drive a hard bargain for the prices are steep. The view of the fort is almost  missing so you are mostly looking at the city streets

title: Underwhelming
review: When we visited many of the sections were closed for reconstruction, preservation etc. The (few) artefacts shown were okay, some were quite dusty and behind dirty glass panels. The queens quarters were very disappointing. A whole room with a chair behind glass and a painting on the wall which the audio guide described... nothing to do with the queen if I remember correctly. The folk music section was also baffling, a dark room with 2 information boards with writing all over them? I guess it’s worth a visit though just to see.

title: Fascinating
review: Any palace really fascinates we all girls and this one is also one of the great and fascinated place. History repeats, enjoyable.

title: Wow
review: A totally unique and unforgettable experience - would highly recommend a visit here - The royals were here suring our attendance

title: Nice to complete the itenary
review: This fort is apparently the second oldest to be built in Rajasthan (chittorgarh being the oldest). Found this to be the only fort where people still reside (About 4000 people as per our guide). Hence one finds houses, gullies, bazaars,temples, ppl riding bikes etc. Maharaja palace is decent but there are better ones in Rajasthan.

title: Nice place to witness the old life style of king
review: It is the nice place to witness the old life style of king. You can have a birds eye view of the entire jaisalmer city from the top of this place.

title: Maharaja's Palace
review: Maharaja's Palace is inside he Jaisalmer Fort. this place is also the oldest palace in Jaisalmer. collection of King's things are also available there. unforgettable experience.

title: Don't go to this place!!
review: The fort itself is impressive of course, but this fort museum has nothing so special however you would think that since you are here then it is worth a visit. But not at all!

title: So worth your time
review: This place gives you an insight as to the history of Jaisalmer as well as how the maharajas lived. You also learn about the architecture, which is supposedly earthquake proof, because some the elements are built to collapse easily, and how they waged war.

title: Palace within Jaisalmer Fort
review: Definitely worth a visit to see the lifestyle and living quarters of the then royalty.However during peak season it is crowded and noisy with various groups and their guides.Stairways are narrow and stairs steep.Audio tours are available at a fee.Tickets are required to enter the palace.Get there early as it gets very crowded.Admire the carved doorways and get an idea of the opulence of that time.The rooftop offers great views of the city.An hour us enough to see the whole palace.

title: Not so nicely kept but worth a visit still
review: although this palace and the rani mahal are not in the best of condition yet having come to the fort one should take a round of the palaces

title: Not an Individual attraction
review: It is inside the fort as a part of it, hence not to be taken as a separate structure. Same with the MAHARANI's palace.

title: One of the top atractions inside the Fort
review: The Maharaja Palace, as well as the Maharani Palace included in the same entry ticket, is a very interesting building within the walls of the city Fort. It helps you understand the history and evolution of this very special city, its people and its ruling class

title: beautiful maharaja palace
review: The Fort is lovely in itself and so is this part which is the maharajas places converted into a museum now. A living fort not seen so much in India as most are museums, hotels or abandoned- this one is thriving with people and life. I suggest the best way to explore it is walking and lost of shops and restaurants to discover enjoy the lovely views from the museum top and see the gorgeous Jain temples as well. Take the audio guided tour which explains everything well.

title: Entry ticket a bit expensive
review: Considering the condition of the palace, the entry fee is expensive. The money is definitely not going towards the maintenance of the palace. The public toilet, for example, is terribly dirty. The palace has much to offer, but it can be presented better. Items on display are hardly visible beyond the dirty glass panels. I also did not like being forced into a jewelry shop at the end of the tour.

title: Beautiful palace
review: While in the fort precincts, gaze up and marvel at the outsides of this palace (now converted into a museum), which has intricate carvings, and the pigeons resting in the ornate recesses adds to the charm of this palace. Thus, it is sure to arouse the photographer in you.

title: Lovely palace
review: This is palace is well worth a visit.  At the entrance you have pay a camera fee 100 rupee.  Inside the palace some lovely rooms including the throne room and silver throne.  The view from the top of the palace is excellent out across the city and fort.

title: I a very happy
review: Food is very good tradition dish Rajasthan dal bati churma a/ c restaurant nice service owner is very good

title: World heritage Monument in Jaisalmer
review: Really artistic and architectural..need to have good amount of time to see and walk around... and enjoy...

title: Good experience, though this place needs more maintenance
review: Raja mahal and Rani mahal combine together to form Fort Palace. Here you can see glimpses of how they lived. The mahal looks very amazing from outside.

title: Take the audio tour to get the most out of the palace
review: Located just inside the fort proper, the palace is a wealth of Rajput history and architecture. It's worth taking the audio tour as it is very comprehensive.

title: An average place
review: There is nothing really much to see except a dress and bed of a 7 feet tall king. OVer all this is a very average fort as compared to other forts in Rajasthan which are way more majestic.

title: Interesting stories
review: This is some of the smallest palaces you will find in Rajasthan. So you will have to have a guide to come up with some interesting stories about some of the Kings. On a whole it doesn't disappoint you, but make sure you hire a guide.

title: Nice palace musium inside
review: Maharaja's palace is inside of main fort of jaisalmer, it is really nice with original things of maharajas as a museum. must visit place if vising jaisalmer.

title: Romantic Palace !
review: Straight out of all those Arabian Nights fantasies ! So romantic and beautifully decorated in excellent original condition. Allow 2_3 hours.

title: Average place, not worth the money
review: If you have been to Jaipur and Udaipur, you will feel the pain of spending Rs. 100 per visitor for this palace. I felt the entry fee was quite high even though the palace is not anything special. Out of all the palaces and havelis in the fort, it is sad to see that you have to pay at all the places separately even though they are not up to the mark. I would say this place AVERAGE.

title: inside Jaisalmer Fort
review: It is a small palace well maintained and full of historical significant artefacts. Some intrinsic artwork

title: Excellent Audio Tour
review: By the time we made it to Jaisalmer, we were sick of tour guides. At the palace museum, we got the audio guides instead and were very happy about the decision. There is a lot of interesting information about the museum without overloading the visitor. There is a lot to see and take in. The museum is well-maintained and a fascinating look at how the royal family lived. A lot of the museum was under renovation so we didn't see some key aspects.

title: Ignore advice from some locals, this is worth visiting
review: Other than the Jain temples this is the only place worth visiting inside the Fort. Its well maintained and if you like your history you will enjoy this place as it is full of history, lots to read and think about.

title: too small for an expericne
review: this palace is not even close in comparison to palaces of jaipur, udaipur  and mysore. if you have seen those you can skip this palace. its a very small place with hardly anything to display except a few weapons, furniture and clothes.  also entry fees is rs 100 which is too much for this place. they even charged 100 rs for my mobile camera and I could hardly find 2 to 3 places where I could take a pic. absolutely not worth paying for the camera. not at all a place to take pics.  the only saving grace of the palace was the view of the city from the terrace..do not miss that if you want to recover your entry fees.

title: Nothing much here
review: Its a place with costly entrance fee and almost nothing as compared to some other palace museums in Rajasthan

title: just "maharajish" unforgettable
review: When we were there we enjoyed walking around...

title: There's better palaces in India, do not waste your money here.
review: So, India increased the entries for foreigners to visit their monuments and you are wondering if this thing worth the money. DO NOT GET IN. You are going to waste your time and money. You can get better views and photos from the outside. We have visited a lot of palaces in the forts in India and this one has nothing interesting in it. Even our kids found it boring (and they like visiting palaces).

title: Beautiful and understated
review: This palace is more simple than the others in Rajasthan, because it is so far out, on the edge of the desert. The fort (not the palace, however) is also unique in that it is inhabited  so not as much of it can be cordoned off for admission fees, and therefore harder to restore. I did find the palace to be pretty expensive for what is there (especially in comparison to the others in India) but it is worth going to see how these royals lived in the space between sand and civilization - you get a great sense of this from the roof, seeing the desert spread out in all directions.

title: Wonderful tour of the Fort Palace
review: Definitely a wonderful fort with many interesting facts and details.  The carvings on all the exteriors are absolutely amazing an d like all palaces in Rajasthan the luxury in which these Raja's lived is incredible.  The view of the Dessert and lake in the distance from the fort is worth the price alone.

title: Not worth spending money
review: Entrance to palace for foreigner is 500rs plus 100rs for camera and you have included audio guide in it with (1,5h). It guides you through some rooms and halls of the old palace, showing some object, but not so many. The audio guide sometimes mention some object, that are not there and you feel confused. The best part of this was visit on the roof, the highest point in Jaisalmer, from where you could see jain temples and all city around. Rest of tour in my opinion was waste of money, this entrance fee was way to expensive. The decoration of interior was not so reach, there was not so many object and the audio guide seems to be much  longer then needed or should be.

title: Nothing Unique..
review: It does give a glimpse of the Royal lifestyle. But we did not find it that appealing. Its just another place with collections of things used by royals. Most of the area is restricted. Narrow passages are suffocating when overcrowded. But you can visit to get the royal overview.

title: A fun walk!
review: There are lots of palaces and forts and so on, but this palace is very nice. There are a lot of rooms with some original furniture which really helps imagine what it all really looked like. I would recommend visiting and obviously taking a comfortable pair of sneakers.

title: Must see
review: One of the best things in Jaisalmer. Tour with guide is worth. Afternoon visit is recommended as top floor offers scenic views of city & sunset

title: Opulence
review: Must see for all, it showcases the luxury the Indian rajas used to live in medieval times, the views of the city are incerdible.

title: Place of King(Maharaja)
review: The palace has different types of big and beautiful rooms which reflects the old architecture of Jaisalmer.The main hall of the palace  displays paintings of Maharaja.History lovers must visit this amazing palace.

title: Old place of Royal family residence
review: Located within Jaisalmer Fort this place was once the residence of Royal family. The place is really old and damaged over time, some of the stuff is still kept for tourists to witness various rooms, weapons and jewellery. Very historic otherwise nothing special to see.

title: King's chamber!!!
review: Go to Jaisalmer fort and book an audio guide. Guide will take you to King's chamber and it's delightful to watch. The facts about the chamber are mind boggling. It's a must visit place if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: "Conservation at Work"
review: It was very pleasing to visit this 850 year old Palace and witness the fruits of the painstaking restoration taken place over the last few years to enable a grand peace of India culture and history to share its story!

title: Royal place
review: Maharajas palace, the delightful kings chamber. Located within Jaisalmer Fort (Golden Fort), Place i really old yet beautiful old architecture of Jaisalmer.

title: Beautiful and graceful palace
review: Maharajah palace is a part of the Jaisalmer fort and its beauty sticks you to visit again. The luxury lifestyle of the kings were clearly showcased in the palace architecture. Terrace view from the palace was mind blowing, as it covers entire Jaisalmer city. Photography is charged at some areas inside palace. This palace is ideal for 3 hours visit.

title: Of course ...u need to see royalty if u r in rajasthan
review: Like a place a maharaja wld live

title: See how the maharajah really lived
review: The palace held lots of domestic items from the time of the maharajah, which really gave an insight to how they lived.

title: It's good to be the Maharaja !
review: Area in the fort that must have been very sumptuous in its day.  Let your imagination wander and think about how it was to live in the most luxurious way possible at the time,

title: Must visit place!
review: Its worth visit place in Jaisalmer.

title: Another stunning fort!!
review: Jaisalmer was one of the last cities visited on our tour and didn't disappoint.  This palace is also well kept and preserved.  The palace is absolutely stunning, each room really does take some time to absorb the details.  You will be busy taking many photos in this palace. Don't miss it!!

title: Lots of amazing artwork and history
review: Amazing artwork and history, don't miss it. Our guide who only cost 200 rupees took us everywhere and explained things clearly - well worth it.

title: very costly
review: entry ticket is 100 but audio guide is 400.even tajmahal is not that costly.without guide nothing much to see and understand no self explanatory boards.so we finished it within an hour.

title: Great visit !
review: I have to admit I have become a bit picky when it comes to palaces and forts as I came across some

title: A royal place with a bad entry
review: A vivacious palace which has been well maintained by the Hotelier for the portion its been transformed to a hotel. The remaining place is very small and dark. The place has large gateways and the only room of exhibits is too small to raise curiosity. The entry to the palace is perhaps a stable and stinks. Located at such a prime place the entry can be remodeled to attract tourists. .

title: Majestic palace inside the Jaisalmer fort
review: Our guide first took us to this palace inside the jaisalmer fort. This is a majestic palace with nice architectural works. From the palace you could get a good view of the city. You should visit this place when you visit Jaisalmer fort.

title: Amazing experience of Golden City
review: This is the first and last living fort in India. If you are in Jaisalmer then you should have to visit this palace to know about royal life and history and dont go without a guide. Its made of different kind of stone which glow like gold because of sun light reflection.

title: Wonderful
review: You can see the items used by the king in this section. The sword and the gown is worth to watch. Do not miss the gigantic gown which is 15 kg in weight

title: Palace with little charm
review: This palace has almost lots its glory and charm, thanks to the negligence and ill-maintenance of authorities. There is hardly anything worthy left. Hope someone takes a note of this.

title: Family Trip
review: This was a trip down memory lane.  This is more about history and knowledge.

title: Very nice place
review: Nice heritage palace but not maintained well. A foul smell of bat shot will always haunt you. Lots of beautiful architecture. Very nice view from top of fort of jaisalmer city and nearby places. Only suggestion for travelers would be to hire government approved tourist guide, they certainly add value by their knowledge.

title: Long Maharaja dress
review: Basically, in Jaisalmer fort, there is a small section which is converted in meuseum which contains Maharaja dress and cot. The hall is little modernized with marble.

title: Glimpse into Rajas' lifestyle at Jaisalmer Fort
review: This is a part of Jaisalmer Fort and features the various Rulers of Jaisalmer, their artillery, rooms and amenities, clothes, etc. There is a lot of history to the place and architecture is beyond doubt beautiful. You get to experience the heritage of Rajasthan at the palace.

title: good to see
review: Experience the lavishness and the great life of those ruler who have enjoyed life like anything. Nothing beats the royalty and grand style of their life.

title: Glimpse of the past
review: Wow this was another treat and there was the Maharajas dress  hanging up in his bed suite.  The man was around 7 ft I think a giant amongst men in his era

title: Outstanding façade and beautiful views of Jaisalmer and Thar Desert ...
review: You are about to visit "Raj Mahal", the royal palace of the Maharawals of Jaisalmer since the 16th century, at the very heart of this enchanted "Golden City" and its magical Fort! The palace has many names - "Raj Mahal", "Rajmahal", "Raja Ka Mahal", "Maharaja's Palace", "Fort Museum" and even "Fort Palace Museum", what confuses us, poor tourists. Anyway, this splendid small palace is a must visit for anyone touring Jaisalmer! "Raj Mahal" was built around 1500, in the finest Rajput architectural style, by the most skilled craftsmen of that time. This seven-storied building, with intricate latticed windows and outstanding façade, displays a small collection of antique objects -  throne, paintings, mosaics, arms, beds, chairs, lamps and clothing - belonging to the Royal Family of Jaisalmer, displayed on mirrored and marbled halls. On its upper floor, a terrace and unforgettable views of this labyrinthine city, its Fort and, in the background, the magnificent Thar Desert! Enjoy!

title: Great Views of Jaisalmer and the Desert, Decent Cultural Perspective
review: N.B.:  When I went to the museum (early October 2016), many of the exhibits were closed.

title: A part of the fort Visit.A must see
review: The most satisfying part of the Fort visit.Good Exhibits.Could have been better preserved and organised.

title: Just see while passing by
review: Its a palace on your way to the Golden Fort. This is less fampous and deservedly so. Not as beautiful as some of the other palaces you would get to see in Rajasthan. While passing by just give it a try but do not spend much time here.

title: Must visit!
review: Jaisalmer Fort- is one of incredible forts in Rajasthan, they charge 500Rs for entrance to Palace,but even if you  skip visiting it tyou still can enjoy the fort but itself, it is unique and impressive by its own atmosphere, narrow streets and local houses.

title: Not worth visiting
review: I would recommend skipping it if you visited forts in Jaipur or Jodhpur.. Visiting forts seemed too repetitive and waste of time.. just enjoy the "Chanch" outside the fort and leave..

title: Skip it and you'll not miss much
review: Rating this as average is as optimistic I could get. Rajasthan is full of forts and palaces, and If you would compare this Palace inside the Jaisalmer fort, this is a disgrace.

title: Not that great
review: If you have visited Mehrangarh, Uday Palace  or Amer Fort in Rajasthan, you may get a little disappointed. There is nothing inside which seems too royal. The upkeep is quite ordinary and it stinks in some areas. The only great part of the palace is a view of the city from top. The weapons kept there are not a great collection and it's hard to believe the furniture kept there were used by royalty. After paying a fee for your camera, you keep searching for any opportunity to click.

title: Small but well maintaiined palace
review: this is one of the few rooms that are available for viewing inside the Jaisalmer fort. The palace is where Maharaj used to stay

title: Architecture keep the place going..
review: Compared to other forts such as Bikaner, this fort does not have much to offer. Architecture is beautiful on the outside, example, the jharoka windows, but once inside its not "breath-taking" beautiful or rich in artefacts.

title: Palace
review: This is where the Film Sarfarosh & Hum dil de chuke snam were shot in the pristine glory & precincts of the fort.

title: Elegance from the past is icing on the cake in this fort
review: This sprawling palace is worth the entry fee compared with some of the hyped historic attractions in Rajasthan.

title: palace having bollywood link
review: visited the Maharaja Palace on 01.01.2016 while visiting Jaisalmer Fort. The old furniture, clothes, household items were beautiful to see.

title: Historic monument
review: compared to some of the palaces and forts in Rajasthan, this one is not as opulent or colourful - but then you have to understand that at that time, Jaislamer was hard to access and there was only desert all around. The palace is functional but some of the rooms are beautifully done.

title: People who rode to their death
review: Not as large as some other in Rajasthan but very interesting. When all was lost militarily, they would essentially go out to battle to a certain death and the women would kill themselves. this happened more than once here. Really a desert town and fortress. Far from the center of the Raj.

title: It’s official name Jaisalmer Fort Palace Museum & Heritage Center
review: There is entry fee to visit this fort but its worthy to pay. Good collection of art & crafts and well maintained fort.

title: Impressive Rooms
review: Lavish decor and sumptuous furnishings make these royal rooms very attractive and one can easily imagine the life style once enjoyed by the Maharajas.

title: royal visit
review: a beautiful and architectural marvel. But the palace is to be cleaned around the surroundings and parking areas which are very dirty

title: Jaisalmer Palace
review: Palace is now a museum with all the antiques used by the royals from arms, ammunition's, swords. A walk in the past.

title: Interesting but rather limited
review: Having been to the overwhelming Jodhpur fort (which is a *must see* location), I ventured into the fort at Jaisalmer.

title: Nice Palace
review: This a huge palace and can not be seen in a hurry. Do take a guided tour if possible as they will tell you all about the history and architecture. Ask the guide if he knows about the architecture etc before hiring him. Also different guides will quote different prices so ask around.

title: This is part of the Jaisalmer Fort.
review: Another Place which u will come in ur way if u opt to visit Jaisalmer Fort.

title: nice palace
review: Its within the fort, it just another palace, but have seen better. Has many antiques, ammunitions and arms. There is an entry fee  both foreigners and Indians. Can be missed.

title: Maharaja Palace
review: It is a very luxurious property situated right in the city of Jaisalarmer. It has a hotel section which is not accessible to tourists. It has a short trip for museum of the belongings of the queen and the king. It would not take more than 1 hour to visit the same.

title: Well preserved
review: The Maharaja Palace has a well preserved collection of various artifacts right from the spears and guns to the seats and beds of the Kings. There is a small entry fee for the same and cameras are charged extra, but is definitely worth the visit for history lovers. The visit to the highest point of the fort is the best add on. You can see the entire city from there.

title: Nice
review: It is one of best and beautiful palace. It is inside the fort. It is a museum cum palace. You can see all the old stuffs. View is amazing from the top of the fort. You can see the whole Jaisalmer.

title: Okay Palace, Jodhpur is better!
review: The entry pricing is much higher compared to Jodhpur fort which is more fascinating than this and also has lot of artifacts. This place gives the historical details and importance but does not attract so much. Views of the town, lake are good from the top of the fort. If time permits it can be visited else can be skipped.

title: Well Preserved Historical Place
review: One of the key attractions while visiting Jaisalmer. A good, well preserved place to see the history of king and his family.

title: nice fort
review: nice fort.

title: Decent Fort
review: I'm personally not a big fan of palaces and would therefore give this a low priority compared to other activities and options available at Jaisalmer. You can go there if you have enough time at your hands.

title: good visit
review: This is inside the jaisalmer fort, however it accounts for an entry fee as well as a fee for your camera. From the top you can get a view of the entire jaisalmer

title: Mehrangarh Fort Visit will be a best one with a Guide.
review: one suggesion is when you buy the fort entry ticket, buy a ticket for a guide (approx. rS.200 for 4 persons).the fort visit will not be beneficial without a guide as it is worthy to hear the history from guide. array of weapons, mortar, arts, expensive stuffs are in display. nice captivating places for taking souvenior pictures with family and friends. you can get small eats, lassi, mineral water, cold beverages at reasonable price inside fort.

title: Overpriced attraction
review: The entire palace is constructed out of the same golden stone as that of the fort.

title: okay typed
review: i visited the place.it is just okay type and i did not find it great. can be visited once if you have enough time.

title: This is a must See-- Core attraction
review: This is inside the Golden fort. Takes around 1 to 1,1/2 hrs to visit the palace. This palace is very well maintained and has entry fee. Very good display of history. One must try.

title: beautiful and huge
review: i am so fascinated with this place how these maharajas would have lived this charismatic life in these huge palaces i loved this place

title: Rich heritage of Royal family
review: Its a place within the fort and was a bedroom and personal area of ruler. Nicely decorated with excellent wall panel work all around

title: Royal Place
review: Home of Royal Family and rich heritage and indian pride. A place you can never miss while travelling Jaisalmer

title: Typical Palace of Maharaja but not well maintained
review: The Maharaja palace in Jaisalmer Fort has rooms which depict the bedroom, exercise room and the audience room of the King. But unfortunately due to the poor upkeep, they do not reflect the former glory.

title: The king's room inside the fort
review: This is the room inside Jaisalmer Fort where the king used to live. This room is now closed and you can only look from outside. It is said, the kind that time was very well build. A big dress is still hanged on the wall, said to be the king's dress of that time. This place will come as a part of Jaisalmer Fort tour.

title: Nothing special
review: Have seen better forts.the fort is average.the exterior is way better than the interior. The entry fee is Rs 100 per head, which according to me is over priced.

title: Maharaj's palace
review: The place was interesting but there was nothing new.. It was like all the palaces that one might visit

title: good experience
review: We took the tour of the palace ourselves and it was interesting to see how old this palace was and still looks magnificent. It was a short yet nice tour.

title: Avoid
review: you have to pay an entry fee to see the maharaj's deserted house,not worth at all,avoid if you can..

title: Maharaja palace..!!
review: Maharaja palace is inside the Jaisalmer golden fort, with a museum to see with the collection of things of times of Maharajas

title: Nothing Much to see
review: This palace is little bit small if comparing to another palaces. But it is the oldest one in Rajastan. From the palace you can see the view all over Jaisalmer, it's truly golden city and also the desert around the city. Inside the palace will show you the story of this palace and about Maharawal of Jaisalmer. Its part of fort & one can see some armory & maharaja & rani rooms only.

title: If you visit Jaipur forts/palaces before this - Give this a miss
review: Nothing great about it,but if you are keen to see how things were different in each region of Rajasthan. Then,visit this - located within the fort - it takes about 1 hour for a tour!

title: We almost didn't go in, but decided why not.
review: We almost didn't go in, but decided why not. It doesn't take too long to go through all the rooms and artefacts and it is well worth it since this is the highlight inside the fort.

title: Jodhpur palace
review: A Beautiful palace which bears lot of stories.The engraving on the walls, floor was marvelous. The king's room the quuen's room ,Dewane khaas .everthing is a beauty.

title: Excellent Palace
review: see the royal palace with old time glory, the city view from roof top is amazing. If you are travelling to jaisalmer you cannot leave this place from your travel list.

title: Real royalty
review: Just saw the museum.

title: Not worth it
review: This is as expensive as the fort in Jodhpur and it's really not worth the money. The palace is not well maintained, some areas are closed, the autoguide is long and tedious, you need to pay extra for pictures (even with a phone) and you can be done in half an hour to an hour.

title: Its ok- there are better palaces than this
review: The palace is ok. Not very great - I would suggest people to go to Jaigarh/Amer palace near Jaipur if they really want to see something beautiful and worth all the time that they are spending. The only thing in Jaisalmer that is worthy is the desert safari. Otherwise its a useless place.

title: A great place to visit
review: It is a thing you should do when travelling in Rajastan, to visit the Maharaja palace in each city. This palace is little bit small if comparing to another palaces. But it is the oldest one in Rajastan. From the palace you can see the view all over Jaisalmer, it's truly golden city and also the desert around the city. Inside the palace will show you the story of this palace and about Maharawal of Jaisalmer

title: Part of Jaisalmer Fort
review: This can be covered as part of Jaisalmer Fort, the maharaja's bed is laid out there along with other fineries and intricacies. Very well decorated and maintained.

title: palace
review: This monument shows the style of residence of maharaja's own & family members'..preserved carefully& maintained very carefully...must see......

title: It is loot
review: Its just loot they charge huge amount to show bats. No warmth no knowledge, no maintenance. Do not go there. Better visit Patwon ki haveli maintained and the staff is courteous.

title: Its a small portion In a Big Palace
review: This is a small portion of Jaisalmer fort. The area were the king lived in the fort is called Maharajas Palace.

title: Superb!
review: It is in the main palace inside the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Glimpses of the past Royality !!!
review: A marvel of architecture!! worth visiting these forts of rajasthan. You will be stunned by seeing the carving all over. The thoughtful structure which prevents them from heat during summer. double walled rooms and jharokhas are worth looking at.

title: excellent
review: this palace is inside jaisalmer fort.i saw beautiful paintings in the palace .good architecture too.the kings room and hall are beautiful.

title: Top spot
review: Once inside the fort, this is the top attraction. Not nearly as stunning as most of India's fort palaces, there's still a lot to see here, although you'll find the running order of the audio tour a bit tricky. The numbers don't go in sequence and you may find yourself having to double back for stuff you miss. Definitely the highlight of Jaisalmer.

title: Palace is a small?
review: August 2014

title: Not the best of locations
review: The place itself is not really stuffed with items, rather the architecture and the rooms make for an interesting visit but the objects on display are a few, and part of them where not accessible because of restorations or because they were sent away. The audio guide included in the admission fee is a decent history lesson and not always related to the indicated museum item. The officials in the place also decided it was better to kick us out 15 minutes earlier then closing time so some guy at the exit could try to sell us some trinkets, quite disgraceful. The view on top of the palace is a nice location though, with 360 view towards the city, there they'll make it double sure you payed the extra camera fee. It just felt like a ruined heritage, great potential in there but not he best management.

title: good but have seen better
review: the place needs renovation and some people to make it attractive to the tourist. and plz folks be prepared to walk around narrow corridor...

title: It is a pity that not all rooms are available for visiting!
review: An elegant seven-story palace with towers which rise over the main square of the Fort, partly built on top of Hawa Pol (fourth gate of the Fort). The most interesting places are decorated with mirrors and paintings, one of which is the bedroom of Rang Mahal (ruler of XVIII century Mulraj II). The gallery treasures sculptures of the XV century, donated by the rulers of the temple fortress. Another intriguing place is the spectacular 360-degree view from the roof.

title: A peep into the royal past
review: Jaisalmer Fort houses the former royal residence is now a museum housing a great collection of artifacts.  Worth seeing is the silver coronation throne, bed, local stamps, banknotes, and sculptures.  From the rooftop of the palace the view of Jaisalmer is awesome. Worth an hour of your time, at least.

title: You will find your self like a King
review: now can dream in past how the king living with king size things

title: Really a Raja
review: The palace is very good to see. The architect and designs are very different. This unique features make it a Maharaja palace.

title: Worth a visit
review: Certainly worth visiting for a look into a previously opulent lifestyle.  Lots to see from beautiful rooms to old relics. Audio guide was very helpful.

title: A Fort that lives.
review: Of the many Forts we saw on our 12-day tour of Rajisthan, all of which were stunning, this one in Jaisalmer is still in use,  People live, work and lead their daily lives in this Fort.  It gives one a taste (albeit modern) of what life might have been like in it's early years.  Don't miss it!!

title: Much better than the other Rajasthan palaces
review: I recommend the audio guide. It's really informative and brings the place alive. The palace is well laid out and has good exhibitions, most of which were open when we visited.

title: Interesting..!!
review: The Maharajas palace in Jaisalmer is decent. Not that big as the palaces in Udaipur or Jaipur. But one does get an insight into the glorious living style of the then Maharaja of Jaisalmer.

title: Good Palace
review: This is again converted to Hotel partly. In another portion the Royal family resides and part of it is open to public. The portion which is open to public is very small but beautiful. It is a must visit.

title: one time visit
review: nice palace displaying various things used by the Maharaja's. Adjacent to it is the Maharani palace which is comparably small. nice beautiful and interesting all in all.

title: Fort inside the fort ;)
review: It is inside the Jaisalmer fort. It showcases the princely charm the city possesses. It gives information about the rule at that time, the artilleries used, the deities worshiped and their life. All the kings that ruled the city are mentioned.

title: A small but nice place to see!!!
review: Has Maharaja Palace and adjacent to it Rani Palace... Has got nice collections and nice view of the city amongst all the other things...

title: Take the Audio Guide to make Visit Worthwhile.
review: Not the most interesting Palace I have visited but I thought the audio guide elevated the experience a bit.

title: full of interest
review: The palace is not an easy building to grasp as it is packed in alongside other buildings within the spectacular fort. The tour, for which there is a good audioguide, winds up and down stairs through mostly small rooms, with some fine artefacts on display, some graceful courtyards with beautiful carved stonework and some dramatic views from the rooftop. Not as grand as some of the other Rajastan palaces but well worth a visit.

title: Mandir Palace - A good musuem
review: Quite a collection of the Maharaja. One can get to see a lot of artifacts of that time. As in other palaces & forts of Rajasthan, a good part of the palace is converted to a hotel.

title: Excellent audio guide
review: An interesting place to explore. The audio guide is excellent and really enhances the experience. Unfortunately for current guests (but better for the future) a number of rooms are closed as they're undergoing restoration.

title: Lovely palace, great audioguide.
review: It is a lovely palace, situated inside the fort. Not perhaps as much to see as in some other palaces, especially as some of the rooms were temporarily closed. But a great view from the rooftop over the town and the rest of the fort. And a really good audioguide, which told you so much about the history and put it all into context. For instance their short section on the Jain religion was so much clearer and more interesting than the whole long audioguide you get when vsiting the Jain temples in Jaisalmer themselves.

title: Amazing experience
review: Do not miss this place. This is one the best parts of the Jaisalmer Fort as its being maintained privately by the Royal Family. It takes alteast 1 hour to explore this place and the view of the town from the rooftop is priceless. There is a lot of history hidden behind the walls of the Jaisalmer fort, you will enjoy knowing about it.

title: Good
review: Nice misum in jaisalmer fort .before maharaja living thre but now that is musiem .

title: Good place, well maintained.
review: The place is good. Property is well maintained, you will find the place in so many Bollywood Film. Just visit the place and co-relate.

title: A really good display
review: This was another example of heritage displayed by a private trust, so well kept, clean, well displayed, someone cared...(as compared to government run tourism...squallor, ill-mannered and disinterested caretakers, ill displayed heritage. Like the fort)

title: Insight into the royal lives
review: This palace is a museum located in Jaisalmer Fort, it gives you an insight about the royal lives of Maharawals. Architecture is excellent like all such places in Jaisalmer.

title: MONEY LOOT
review: This sort of attractation cannot boost our Indian tradition. Please stop looting people. Entry fees does not worth the display inside.

title: Well-maintained Palace + Audio Tour
review: The Fort Palace entrance is on the right hand side of the first open courtyard of Jaisalmer Fort, near the entrances for the Jain Temples. It costs 300 Rs./pp, including an audio tour + extra 100 Rs. camera fee. The audio tour was surprisingly excellent and gave opportunities for further information at various points. The rooms are well-preserved and feature displays of interior design, furniture, clothing, and other pieces from the daily life of Rajasthani royalty. A highlight of our time in Jaisalmer!

title: Historic Palace - Nothing Exciting
review: Artefacts and royal items preserved inside the palace showing the history of the royal family. The palace is within the fort of Jaisalmer.

title: Nice Palace,converted into a museum
review: this is a nice palace,situated inside the fort.

title: Disappointing
review: As in other things in India, the upkeep, look & feel, hygeine etc is so very very filthy that the grand old buildings of the past have become terrible. The Fort overall is like the old, filthy part of any large city. Too crowded, too congested, too dirty, too noisy, etc. The Palace part also is very ordinary/pedestrian. It takes the glory of the yester-years away.

title: one of the places to be visited in jaisalmer
review: nothing very special,nothing very palace like impression on seeing it, nice view of the jaisalmer city from the palace,can see a collection of the royal family armoury etc of that time.Like anyother museum visit

title: Enjoyable
review: An interesting museum with several artefacts of note and a good audio guide offering a history of the fort and city. Overall enjoyable and worth a visit.

title: "Best fort in rajasthan ."
review: Jaisalmer fort is best fort in rajasthan .I had been many time in this mahraja's palce.is very beautiful and also nice view of city of Jaisalmer.

title: amazing
review: best palace i have seen-amazing view-amazing history-amazing maharaja - and we saw the living maharaja fort also i wish cud meet him-MUST VISIT

title: One-time watch
review: You have seen much better forts than this one! There is not much to display in the museum, however, the intricate detailing of the walls with its ornate work is breath-taking. The inside of the museum has nothing mentionable.

title: Wonderful palace
review: One of the best palaces in Rajasthan. Visit with audioguide very interesting, too bad some of the rooms were closed, same for the museu m shop. View on Jaisalmer and the desert from the top roof was amazing.

title: A Palace inside the fort
review: A city residing inside a 400 year old fort.Till date. Adds vibrancy & livelyness of the palace. Awesome view of Jaiselmer from the top.

title: Insight into life of Maharaja
review: A beautiful palace inside the fort, this place gives a perfect insight into the life of Maharaja. Right from his daawat rooms to bedrooms to game areas. Its a complete experience.

title: Great insight into life as a Maharajah
review: The Palace is well kept and provides a very good (included ) audio guide to the visit. The Palace is at the heart of the fort and it was easy to get a feel for what life must have been like in former times. Exhibits did not thrill too much but the rooms are the stars, together with the location.

title: Not a Heritage anymore
review: Kings and Queens used homes and couldn't maintain them as they used to during their regin....the Palace is live example to this....Part of the Fort has been housed by regular ppl...making it dirty....while the lil part left for the king is converted into tour guided place with lesse heritage to see...

title: Good Visit
review: Very beautiful, it is good to know how the Kings lived and all the rooms and their specialities. The view from some of the terraces was amazing.

title: Small but good palace inside the fort
review: The palace is right inside the Jaisalmer fort, and you can reach it directly if you go straight from the gate.

title: Great palace inside the fort
review: At first we weren't sure we wanted to visit it but thankfully we chose to do it and we loved it. The palace is charming, well kept, small enough so that it doesn't become boring and serves as an excellent excuse to learn more about the tumultous past of this region. There are very interesting rooms, pictures and artefacts here, but the best features are the views of the city and the perfect audioguide with just the right amount of information (don't even bother to get a personal guide, the audioguide will do nicely)

title: Small - with bats and great views
review: It's a small palace.  I got the tour with headset and can't remember any of it now.  There are great views from the top, and there's a part between buildings when you're outside and bats are hanging down.  A lot of them.

title: Solid gold to see
review: A well kept palace.

title: The highlight of a visit to Jaisalmer
review: The Fort Palace is the highlight of a visit to Jaisalmer, and a visit in the late afternoon is a good way to ensure the right kind of lighting for photographs. The view from the roof gives some perspective to the fort and context for a walk around the bastions. Not cheap for foreigners but still worth it.

title: Rajasthani splendour
review: An excellent glimpse into the lives of the royal family of Jaisalmer through the ages. Well preserved artefacts from clothing to weaponary and some quite superb views of the city from the top.

title: Fort within the fort.
review: Maharaja's Fort is a section of the Jaisalmer Fort. It has been converted in to a museum and is well preserved. An interesting peep in to the lives of the royals.

title: Dirty
review: Rajesthan Means Place of Palace,

title: Lovely experience
review: The palace is right inside the Jaisalmer fort, and you can reach it directly if you go straight from the gate.

title: Royal greatness
review: This palace is located inside the Jaisalmer fort and you should visit it while there. Before entering the royal palace I made contact for the first time in India with the sati hand prints on both sides of the entrance. They are hand prints of the living relatives of deceased members of the royal family, which went to be burned alive on the funeral pyres together with the loved or esteemed ones. The tradition required for wives, brothers, sisters, children, friends and servants of the deceased ones to go and accompany their loved ones even beyond death.

title: Part of Jaisalmer Fort
review: Fort has seperate residential area for Maharaja (the King) & Maharani (the Queen).

title: Quite small
review: How can this be only the second review?Others may include it under the fortress which is surely a different entity. The palace is quite small but there is  a lot to see. It lacks the splendour of some of the large palaces on the tourist circuit but is fascinating in its own right, and is probably more typical of a kingdom wrenched by sheer determination from a hostile environment.Entrance fee for foreigners includes an audio guide.You can do without but still have to pay.The audio guide was good  but we could not find 2-3 of the locations.The signs may have been missing. One display room (stamps I think) was closed.

title: Elegant and traditional
review: The Palace within the Fort is a display of beautiful rooms, colorful creative art works, and historical information.

title: Learned something by audio tour
review: Walked around with a headset for the audio tour in Japanese.

title: History buffs will love this...
review: The place is full of historic memories.

title: Skip this if you’re also visiting other palaces in Rajasthan.
review: Only worth visiting if this is your first fort or palace in Rajasthan, not worth the steep foreigner’s price. Displayed material is not interesting and the beautiful stone carving is ubiquitous in Jaisalmer. Spend your time wandering through the alleys or on a rooftop terrace.

title: Interesting.
review: Visited here as part of the visit to Jaisalmer fort. Some interesting rooms displaying furniture and objects from a wide historical period of time. Some of the stair cases are quite steep and narrow

title: Beautiful!
review: A lavishly decorated palace within the fort that has been recreated with furniture, photos, and artefacts of the time the maharajah lived and ruled here. Recommended not to miss this tour.

title: go with a guide
review: Its a great old palace like many others in Rajasthan but go with a good guide who is ready to spend to explain - you could easily spend 3 hours

title: Nothing to see
review: We thought at least the museum will have some decent artefacts to look at. There were dusty old pieces that didn't seem to have really been preserved from the days of the rule.

title: Palace inside the Fort
review: It was a dampener. Once you get in you see the pictures of celebrities who have visited the palace, Amitabh Bachchan being one of them. Really? It was like a studio owner displaying his visitors. The place can be managed in a better manner and with more dignity and pinch of history. The tourists are charged decently, however, what is on offer shows clearly, the lack of interest on part of the royals managing the show. Alas, you visit it because it is part of the fort and you go in because you have to

title: difficult to climb for senior citizens, but worth a visit in case one can climb multiple set of seps at various levels.
review: imagine 800 years back ,such a secure building was constructed  and is still well maintained. furniture, dresses, armoury, some intricately carved panels  are all worth seeing.. more over, the view of city from palace topp deck is really amazing. A model of entire fort available on top floor is too good.

title: Elegant and traditional
review: The Palace within the Fort is a display of beautiful rooms, colorful creative art works, and historical information.

title: Learned something by audio tour
review: Walked around with a headset for the audio tour in Japanese.

title: History buffs will love this...
review: The place is full of historic memories.
